text:
David George Graham MCIPS ACMI
Southport, Merseyside
Mobile: 07782 189485
Email:
General
I have gained a lot of experience through a diverse background of procurement and supply chain best practice over the last 12 years. I am competent, adaptable, lead projects and assured when managing communication with stakeholders at all levels of seniority in an organisation. I am a full member of the Chartered Institute of Purchasing and Supply (MCIPS) and an associate member of the Chartered Management Institute (ACMI). I have an active interest in management and have found it rewarding; my current role involves both local direct management and remote management of teams in other countries. I have a full, clean UK driver’s licence and I regularly travel internationally.
Employment Experience
May 20 David George Graham MCIPS ACMI
Southport, Merseyside
Mobile: 07782 189485
Email:
General
I have gained a lot of experience through a diverse background of procurement and supply chain best practice over the last 12 years. I am competent, adaptable, lead projects and assured when managing communication with stakeholders at all levels of seniority in an organisation. I am a full member of the Chartered Institute of Purchasing and Supply (MCIPS) and an associate member of the Chartered Management Institute (ACMI). I have an active interest in management and have found it rewarding; my current role involves both local direct management and remote management of teams in other countries. I have a full, clean UK driver’s licence and I regularly travel internationally.
Employment Experience
May 2009 to present: NSG Group (Pilkington Group)
Category Manager – Information Services & Professional Services
Following a successful time in the UK Procurement team I was promoted to the role of European Category Specialist and then Global Category Manager.
£80 million+ Spend Management
Creation, Development & Communication of Category Strategy
Local Direct Line Management & Remote Team Management
Global Contract Management with focus on Standardisation initiatives
My current role has given me a good insight into different cultures, sourcing and procurement practices of a number of countries and experience of suppliers across Europe, Japan and North and South America. I am more confident and outgoing in my management style and always ensure that best practice, success stories and praise are shared across the team. I have learned the importance of delegation of tasks best performed locally whilst ensuring I remain approachable and involved when the team require support.
Areas of responsibility					Key Achievements
Information & Communication Technology		Developing & maintaining Category Strategy
Fleet Management					Year on year exceeding objectives including:
Support of Professional Functions			Savings delivery
Property Services					Contract / Supplier Management
Office Consumables					Supporting Sustainability
Printed Goods						Improvement via innovation & added value
August 2006 to May 2009: Pilkington UK Limited
Buyer – Site Services & Capital Expenditure
I was responsible for the procurement of site services, specialist maintenance contracts and capital expenditure for the UK; the services I negotiated varied from simple construction based works to more complex turnkey and specialist projects e.g. asbestos, acoustic and emissions surveys etc. The capital expenditure projects I worked on were typically high value and I treat each case as a specialist project and followed it through from sourcing, qualification to procurement and payment.
Circa £8 million Spend Management
Focus on Best Practice, Supplier Consolidation, Innovation
Contract creation and management
Supplier benchmarking
Risk Management
Training and Procurement lead for new systems integration
Sept 2002 to August 2006: M I Finance Limited
Chief Buyer
I was responsible for the management of supplier and customer relationships and the complete purchasing chain for company and customer vehicles.
Management of complete Procure to Pay (P2P) process
Sourcing of opportunities via supply base
Co-ordination of a cross functional team of five people
Strong prioritisation skills of projects, procurement activity and stakeholders
Sourcing and process standardisation for bespoke vehicle ordering
July 2000 to Aug 2002: UCB Films PLC
Procurement Officer
I was responsible for buying our packaging goods, bulk chemicals, research chemicals and laboratory products, safety wear and stationery products. I also deputised for the engineering buyer on a regular basis and was involved in purchasing steel stocks and engineering components. I believe I possess a good knowledge of each area I worked in and feel I would be able to work in any buying role within these sectors. As I was involved in so many sectors, many being business critical; I regularly worked to tight deadlines and needed to be very organised. I have experience in negotiating prices and delivery according to current market figures, e

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
